result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael L. Roach

records.addlTxt:
11:05 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Michael L. Roach in court.  Attorney Daniel M Key appeared by video for Michael L. Roach.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Key is heard on the status of the case.
Jury status hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Jury status hearing on November 30, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

The original document was titled: Victim Impact Statement
The original history event date is: 08-30-2022

3:00 PM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Michael L. Roach in court.  Attorney Daniel M Key appeared by video for Michael L. Roach.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.

Court reviews waiver of preliminary hearing and questionnaire form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing. 

Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for further proceedings

Atty. Key wishes to proceed to arraignment today

Information filed at this time
Atty. Key waives reading of the information, Defendant enters plea of NOT GUILTY to both counts
Clerk directed to enter  Not Guilty pleas into record as to both counts
Jury status hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury status hearing on October 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 002492,
Payable Number: 71430,

10:29 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Michael L. Roach in court.  Attorney Daniel M Key in court for Michael L. Roach.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:17 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Michael L. Roach appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
     Court finds probable cause.
     D.A. comments; requests cash bond of $1,500; prohibit possess/consume alcohol; testing by L.E.; no violent or abusive contact with E.L.K.
     Def. with no comment.
     Court sets $1,500 cash bond; not possess/consume any alcohol; submit to random PBTs at request of L.E.; if positive, to submit to blood draw; no violent or abusive contact with E.L.K.  Court advises of right to an atty.
     Court concludes at 1:22 p.m.
Hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant not to possess/consume any alcohol; submit to random PBTs at request of L.E.; if positive, to submit to blood draw; no violent or abusive contact with E.L.K.
